page.title: 16Religion in Mowsley.
page.content: Mowsley's old{church}stands in the centre of the village.The parish is part of a group of 4 villages.The fabric of the building is largely as it was at the time of Canon Green's restoration in 1880,& is in good cond- iton.During the drought of 1984 wooden tiles in the roof shrank & fell off,& had to be re-fixed.The 1939-45 memorial clock is being repaired. The{furnishings}inside have undergone change.The vestry has been re-ordered, & old photographs may be seen.A child- rens corner has cushions,carpet,books & pictures.The altar has been moved forward.Alternate{services}Evensong (1662 Prayer Book)& Family Communion (ASB 1980)are held weekly.Average attendance 1984 was 23,but 85 attended Harvest Festival.Heavy snow cancelled 3 services.Children are encouraged to use the church & take part in worship.
